alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 7:42PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Cheyenne and southeastern Kimball Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 641 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles south of Lisco to 9 miles west of Westplains. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of central Cheyenne and southeastern Kimball Counties. Sidney will be affected as well. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 48 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
